articles.title: Protein Discovery New Key to Memory Formation - Neuroscience News
articles.description: Researchers discovered a surprising new function of the protein RPT6 in the brain, which could revolutionize the understanding and treatment of memory disorders.
articles.content:

articles.author: Jennifer Rigby
articles.title: COVID and beyond: labs unite to boost genomic surveillance globally - Reuters.com
articles.description: Two laboratories in Britain and South Africa, which were at the forefront of tracking new coronavirus variants during the pandemic, have teamed up to keep the focus on genomic surveillance globally as the COVID emergency recedes.

articles.author: Silvia Maioli
articles.title: Women are more likely to develop Alzheimer's – but our research suggests a specific brain enzyme could help protect them - The Conversation
articles.description: Two thirds of people with Alzheimer’s disease are women – but activation of a brain protein called CYP46A1 might hold the key to prevention.
articles.content:
The most common form of dementia, Alzheimers, is a progressive, life limiting, neurodegenerative condition, which damages and destroys parts of the nervous system, especially the brain, over time.

articles.title: HIV-1 capsids enter the FG phase of nuclear pores like a transport receptor - Nature.com
articles.description: The HIV-1 capsid behaves like a nuclear transport receptor entering and traversing an FG phase, with its interior serving as a cargo container, bypassing an otherwise effective barrier to viral infection.
